responsibilities: Design and expand build tool functionality to support new WSE hardware and software.
Reproduce, debug, and resolve issues for ML applications such as stalls/nan specific to HW/SW context.
Work with cross-functional teams to further increase the solution lead Cerebras with its competitions.
qualifications: CAD tool design experiences: graph and netlist traversal and analysis.
UI/UX with medium size data visualization.
Good communication skill - be able to present for internal and/or external customers on tool capabilities.
Exceptional coding skills with C++ and Python.
Knowledge of ML is a plus.
analysis: The job responsibilities focus on designing and expanding build tool functionality, debugging and resolving issues for ML applications, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. The skills required include hardware debugging, CAD tool design, UI/UX for data visualization, communication skills, coding in C++ and Python, and knowledge of ML. While there is a mention of a passion for AI and knowledge of ML, there is no specific mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The focus seems to be more on hardware and software integration, debugging, and tool design rather than on developing or working with GenAI or LLMs.
